Identity.History: "Their horses are remarkable neither for beauty nor fleetness. [About the Tencteri] From riding and exercising of horses, their children borrow their pastimes, [...] the young men find matter for emulating one another [...]."\nTacitus, De Origine et situ Germanorum, 98 CE.
Identity.Tooltip: Although the Germanic armies mostly consisted of infantry, some tribes became particularly famous as horsemen. The Batavi for example, who in 43 AD played a decisive role in the Roman subjugation of the Celtic Cantiaci.\nResearch improvements for your cavalry.
